slides.title: What are Web APIs?
slides.content:
# Web APIs ðŸŒ

A Web API is a developer's dream.

It can extend the functionality of the browser.
- **Browser APIs:** Built into your web browser (DOM, Fetch, Geolocation).
- **Third Party APIs:** Provided by third parties (Twitter, Google Maps).

slides.title: Local Storage
Session Storage
slides.content:
# Session Storage â³

Similar to local storage, but expires when the session ends (tab closed).

```javascript
sessionStorage.setItem("lastname", "Smith");
```

slides.title: Fetch API
slides.content:
# Fetch API ðŸ•

The interface for fetching resources (including across the network).

Replaces `XMLHttpRequest`.

```javascript
fetch('https://api.example.com/items')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));
```

slides.title: JSON Basics
slides.content:
# JSON ðŸ“„

JavaScript Object Notation. Standard format for transmitting data.

- Data is in name/value pairs.
- Data is separated by commas.
- Curly braces hold objects.
- Square brackets hold arrays.

```json
{"firstName":"John", "lastName":"Doe"}
```
